title: AP Statistics 2021: Probability and Sampling Distributions
driving_question: How can we use the binomial distribution to calculate the probability of an event in a given time period?

tasks.task_description: Define the random variable as the number of gift cards that a particular employee receives in a 52-week year. Describe the distribution as binomial with n = 52 and p = 0.005.
Identify the event of interest and calculate the probability that a particular employee receives at least one gift card in a 52-week year.

pre_thinking_prompts: How can we define the random variable in this scenario?
What is the event of interest in this scenario?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on the process of using a binomial distribution to calculate probability. What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
ai_tutor_prompts: Remember to define the random variable clearly.
Ensure you understand the binomial distribution before proceeding.
Don't forget to identify the event of interest correctly.
remix_zone: Try to apply the same principles to a different scenario. For example, calculate the probability of a student passing an exam given certain conditions.
